questions.question_text:
An engineer must integrate Cisco ACI with VMware vCenter. The virtualization team configured the necessary port groups and assigned them to virtual machines through VMware vCenter. The final port group configuration must be protected from being changed by Cisco APIC.

Which action accomplishes these goals?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: B
Beginning with Cisco APIC Release 3.1(1), you also can create a read-only VMM domain. A read-only VMM domain enables you to view inventory information for a VDS in the VMware vCenter that Cisco APIC does not manage. Procedures to configure a read-only VMM domain differ slightly from procedures to create other VMM domains. However, the same workflow and prerequisites apply. https://www.cisco.com/c/en/us/td/docs/dcn/aci/apic/5x/virtualization-guide/cisco-aci-virtualization-guide-52x/m-cisco-aci-with-vmware-vds.html

choices.D: Activate CDP and LLDP in the VMM domain.
choices.A: Create the VMM domain with switch mode set to AVE.
choices.B: Set the VMM domain access mode to Read Only Mode.
choices.C: Configure the VMM domain with tag collection.

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: B
bootflash file is incompatible with the switch hardware as stated by Racktoor.

Selected Answer: B
You are trying to install n7k software on an n9k switch, so I would assume that the file is incompatible with the hardware.

It is A! 
Before downgrading software, verify if there are any incompatibilities to make sure features can be properly disabled before performing the downgrade. This will inform the administrator if there are any features that will be automatically removed from the configuration and allow the administrator to take action prior to the downgrade. This command should be run regardless if the ISSU or traditional downgrade method is performed.

Selected Answer: C
word show that C. 

only show, why removed ? so A is not right.

Selected Answer: A
Will be A for sure. Checking features that will be disabled if we change to earlier image

choices.C: that the bootflash file is incompatible with the switch software
choices.D: impact of an in-service software upgrade and chassis reload
choices.B: that the bootflash file is incompatible with the switch hardware
choices.A: features that are removed automatically from the switch

questions.question_text:
Refer to the exhibit.

//IMG//


Users report SAN traffic packet loss on a blade server that is managed by using Cisco UCS Manager. An engineer must implement a SPAN feature to an external Fibre Channel analyzer.

Which configuration source in the TEST monitoring session must the engineer select?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: C
C is the correct answer

This is the most precise and appropriate source for packet loss analysis.

Selected Answer: B
I believe it is B

choices.A: all the VSANs from the server
choices.B: all the uplink Fibre Channel ports
choices.C: all the virtual host bus adapters from the server

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: DE
I choose D & E. I exclude C (taboo contract) because while regular contracts define permitted traffic, taboo contracts are used to specify traffic that should be denied, even if it would otherwise be allowed by a regular contract. So with intra EPG isolation, in my opinion a taboo contract does not make sense

Selected Answer: DE
By enabling intra-EPG isolation, ACI blocks all communication between endpoints within the same EPG by default.
After enabling isolation, you can create contracts to selectively allow certain types of traffic between specific endpoints or classes of traffic.

comments.content:
You are correct.
Its DE. Just tested.

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: CE
Contrat under EPg is called Taboo.
A think is C and E.

Selected Answer: DE
D. Configure intra EPG contract under Web_EPG.
E. Mark intra EPG isolation as enforced.

choices.A: Check box of forward control proxy ARP.
choices.C: Add Taboo contract on the Web_EPG.
choices.E: Mark intra EPG isolation as enforced.
choices.B: Set VRF policy control preference to unenforced.
choices.D: Configure intra EPG contract under Web_EPG.

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: B
Local Disk is excluded by default from the host firmware pack.

To update local disk firmware, always include the Blade Package in the host firmware package. The blade package contains the local disk firmware for blade and rack servers.

questions.question_text: Which component is, by default, excluded from the host firmware package on a Cisco UCS B-Series Server?
